title: World History Assessment
description: This assessment covers key events, figures, and concepts in world history, suitable for high school students. It consists of 20 multiple-choice questions.

questions.question: Who painted the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel?
Julius Caesar was assassinated in which year?
Who was the Greek historian known as the 'Father of History'?
Martin Luther's Ninety-Five Theses were primarily concerned with:
Which document, signed in 1215, limited the powers of the English king?
The Roman Republic was founded in which year?
Which civilization is credited with the invention of writing (cuneiform)?
Who was the Macedonian king who created a vast empire in the 4th century BCE?
What was the Peace of Augsburg (1555)?
options: A treaty ending the Hundred Years' War
A settlement allowing princes to choose Lutheranism or Catholicism
An agreement uniting the German states

questions.question: Charlemagne was crowned emperor in what year?
Which emperor made Christianity the favored religion of the Roman Empire?
What was the significance of the Edict of Nantes (1598)?
options: It ended the Thirty Years' War
It legalized Calvinism in the Netherlands
It granted religious freedom to French Protestants

questions.question: Which war ended with the Treaty of Westphalia in 1648?
Which explorer first circumnavigated the globe?
Who wrote 'The City of God'?
What was the primary effect of the Black Death on European society?
options: Strengthened the power of the Church

questions.question: Which invention greatly contributed to the spread of Renaissance ideas?
The primary language of the Byzantine Empire was:
Which war was fought between Athens and Sparta in the 5th century BCE?
What event sparked the First Crusade?
options: The excommunication of the Byzantine emperor
